title: CACI's Bluestone Analytics Ties With Florida's Torchlight AI
summary: CACI International Inc.'s subsidiary Bluestone Analytics has partnered with Torchlight AI to integrate its DarkPursuit tool into the Torchlight Catalyst platform. This collaboration aims to provide Special Operations Forces (SOF) customers with secure access to the open, deep, and dark web, thereby enhancing real-time decision-making for challenges like irregular warfare. CACI continues to win significant contracts, reflecting strong business development and customer satisfaction, and holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

title: Big Tech Expects Some Assets to Last Longer. But the Boost to Profit Is Temporary.
summary: A growing number of tech companies, including Alphabet, IBM, and Akamai Technologies, are extending the estimated working lives of their servers and network equipment. This accounting change reflects a slower pace of chip development and temporarily boosts profits by cutting costs at a challenging time for the industry. Other major tech firms like Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Oracle, and Amazon.com have also revised these estimates since 2022.

title: Cathie Wood says ARK dumped Nvidia shares before 160% surge because it’s ‘just pivoting’ to other A.I. plays
summary: Cathie Wood defended Ark Invest's decision to sell Nvidia shares before a significant surge, citing concerns about the chip industry's cyclical nature and increasing competition. While Ark's flagship ETF missed most of the rally, Wood stated they are pivoting to other AI plays that are currently undervalued. She highlighted companies like Meta Platforms Inc. for their AI focus, despite not being in Ark's main portfolio.

title: DocuSign layoff announcement comes as tech layoffs continue to rack the industry
summary: DocuSign announced a new round of layoffs, affecting 10% of its staff, or approximately 700 employees, primarily in its field organization. This decision follows a 9% staff reduction in September and aims to position the company for profitable growth and free up resources for investments. These layoffs are part of a broader trend of continued job cuts across the tech industry, with other major companies like Google, Meta, and Amazon also announcing reductions.

title: Apple's stock underperformed top tech peers in 2023 due to longest revenue slide in 22 years
summary: Apple's stock underperformed its mega-cap tech peers in 2023, experiencing its longest revenue slide in 22 years with four consecutive quarters of declining sales. This decline was attributed to a combination of a weak economic environment for smartphones and PCs, and company-specific issues such as the lack of new iPad models and an Apple Watch sales ban. Despite a 49% stock rally for the year, Apple lagged behind competitors like Nvidia, Meta, Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: Magazine roundup: Top 100 data centre companies
summary: Data Centre Magazine reviews its Top 100 data centre companies for 2023, highlighting their commitment to advancing technology and sustainability. The article rounds up the top 10 companies, including industry giants like AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform, detailing their founding, CEOs, and key contributions to the data centre sector. It showcases their innovative solutions, global reach, and efforts toward environmental responsibility.

title: US surveillance giant’s network of operations has subsidiaries in India
summary: US surveillance giant Verint Systems has a network of operations including four subsidiaries in India, as revealed by the Cyprus Confidential investigation. One of Verint's spin-off companies, Cognyte, has faced controversy for allegedly selling spyware to "repressive regimes" and was named by Meta as a "cyber mercenary" for indiscriminately targeting journalists and dissidents. The Indian subsidiaries show significant revenue from foreign group companies and have had run-ins with the Income Tax Department.

title: Salesforce’s Benioff Cashing Out at Rate of $3 Million a Day
summary: Marc Benioff, co-founder of Salesforce, has been consistently selling 15,000 shares of the company's stock, worth about $3 million, almost daily since July. This strategy has resulted in unloading over $475 million worth of shares through approximately 170 transactions this year, a practice he employs to fund charitable gifts. Experts view his systematic selling approach as a "safest" way for CEOs to diversify their holdings without significantly impacting stock prices or violating insider-trading rules.

title: CastleArk Enters ETF Market With Large Growth ETF CARK
summary: CastleArk has launched its first exchange-traded fund, the CastleArk Large Growth ETF (CARK), an actively managed ETF focused on large-cap growth companies. The fund targets 25-30 leading growth companies, identifying competitive strength and seeking to optimize risk through quantitative inputs. CastleArk aims to provide an actively managed alternative to index-heavy portfolios, especially given the concentration of "Magnificent Seven" stocks in the large-cap growth sector.

title: AMD releases new chips to power faster AI training
summary: AMD announced the availability of its new MI300 chips, including the Instinct MI300X accelerator and Instinct M1300A APU, designed to power demanding AI training and large language models. The company also unveiled the Ryzen 8040 mobile processors, which will bring enhanced AI capabilities to laptops in 2024. These releases position AMD to compete more directly with Nvidia in the booming AI chip market.

title: Meta Platforms, IBM create industrywide AI alliance to share technology
summary: Meta Platforms and IBM are leading an industry-wide AI Alliance of over 40 companies and organizations to promote open-source artificial intelligence development. The coalition aims to share technology, reduce risks, and focus on responsible AI development, including safety and security tools. This initiative seeks to increase open-source AI models and foster collaboration with academic researchers.

title: Celestica stock rides another tech wave – but can it avoid a crash this time?
summary: Celestica Inc., a Toronto-based manufacturer, is experiencing a resurgence due to the AI boom, supplying equipment to data centers for major tech companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta. Despite a significant increase in stock price and revenue, questions remain about the sustainability of this growth compared to the company's past crash during the dot-com era. CEO Rob Mionis argues that Celestica is a more diversified and insulated company now, focusing on higher-margin, complex equipment and seeing sustained demand in the early stages of AI development.

title: AI ETFs see huge performance dispersion in 2023
summary: Artificial Intelligence ETFs have shown significant performance dispersion in 2023, with top strategies more than doubling the returns of the lowest performers. This disparity is largely attributed to the heavy weighting of certain ETFs towards US equities and the "magnificent seven" tech stocks. While these mega-cap companies have driven much of the AI theme's returns, there is still potential for pure-play AI companies to join the rally.

title: FAANG Gives Way to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: The "FAANG" stock group has evolved into the "Magnificent Seven," with Netflix replaced by Nvidia, and Microsoft and Tesla added to the mix of top U.S. market names. ETF issuers are beginning to launch products specifically targeting these seven stocks, while existing ETFs like the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) already hold significant concentrations of them. Investors have various options, from highly concentrated ETFs to diversified funds, to gain exposure to these influential companies.

title: Autodesk Workshop XR Delivers Immersive Design Review Experience for the AEC Industry
summary: Autodesk, Inc. unveiled Autodesk Workshop XR, an immersive design review workspace connected to Autodesk Construction Cloud, aimed at the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry. This new tool enables real-time collaboration on 3D models from anywhere, facilitating better decision-making and preventing costly errors. Workshop XR will be available on Meta Quest headsets, enhancing project reviews and sustainability through improved design processes.

title: Coursera class action claims company shares customer viewing history with Meta
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Coursera Inc., alleging the company shares customers' video viewing history and personally identifiable information with Meta Platforms without consent. The lawsuit claims Coursera uses an invisible tracking tool called "Meta Pixel" to facilitate this data sharing, violating the Video Privacy Protection Act. The plaintiff seeks to represent a nationwide class of individuals who viewed Coursera videos while having active Facebook accounts.

title: The Magnificent 7 In Other Countries (Emerging Markets X-China)
summary: This article identifies seven emerging market companies (outside of China) that could become the "next Magnificent 7" in technology, similar to the dominant tech giants in developed markets. It highlights companies from Latin America, India, and Southeast Asia, spanning fintech, e-commerce, and digital services, and details their unique strategies, market positions, and growth potential. The author emphasizes a long-term perspective on these companies' appreciation and their role in the global technology landscape.

title: Shoot, Don’t Kill
summary: Byrna Technologies, a less-lethal weapon manufacturer, is attempting to create a market for "less lethal" guns for self-defense amidst a polarized American gun culture. Their devices use compressed gas to launch non-lethal projectiles, offering an alternative to traditional firearms. Despite challenges in marketing and operational scaling, Byrna aims to appeal to a broad consumer base by highlighting their products as safe and unregulated alternatives for self-defense.

title: Hartford Funds Seeks to Let $4.1B Fund Make More Concentrated Investments
summary: Hartford Funds is proposing to reclassify its $4.1 billion Growth Opportunities Fund as a non-diversified investment, which would allow it to make more concentrated investments. This change, if approved by shareholders, would increase the fund's risk profile and volatility, prompting plan sponsors and fiduciaries to re-evaluate their inclusion of the fund in retirement lineups. The reclassification comes as allocations to a few mega-cap tech stocks have pushed some diversified funds to exceed investment thresholds.

title: Stanford’s AI transparency index shows foundational models are shrouded in secrecy
summary: A Stanford University report reveals that most popular foundational AI models from companies like OpenAI, Google, and Meta lack transparency regarding their development and societal impact. Meta's Llama 2 topped the transparency index, while OpenAI's GPT-4 scored lower despite extensive public information from partners, indicating that open-source models generally lead in transparency. The researchers highlight the need for greater disclosure to inform policymakers and foster trust in AI, especially as regulations like the EU's Artificial Intelligence Act emerge.

title: Stagwell (STGW) Acquires Left Field Labs, Deepening Technology Capabilities in AI, Digital Transformation and Immersive Experiences
summary: Stagwell (NASDAQ: STGW) has acquired Left Field Labs, a digital agency specializing in AI, digital transformation, and immersive experiences, to enhance its technology capabilities. Left Field Labs will join Stagwell's Constellation Network, bringing end-to-end services and expertise in human-centric design to guide clients. This acquisition marks Stagwell's third in 2023, reinforcing its strategy to lead AI-based digital transformation in marketing.

title: Costco Sued, Accused Of Sharing Confidential Health Data With Facebook
summary: Costco is facing a lawsuit in a Seattle federal court, accused of sharing sensitive customer health information with Meta Platforms Inc. through the Meta Pixel tracking tool used on its website. The lawsuit, filed by four California residents, claims Costco violated Washington State's privacy laws by not disclosing its data-sharing practices, especially concerning susceptible health data of pharmacy users. Plaintiffs are seeking a jury trial and financial damages, while Meta states its policies prohibit advertisers from sending sensitive information.

title: Top Performing ETFs: Gold, Income ETFs Top the Charts
summary: This article highlights that gold, commodities, and income options strategies were the top-performing ETFs of the week, with particular success for options-based income ETFs from YieldMax focusing on tech stocks. It notes that commodities like natural gas also performed strongly, likely due to market fears, while gold strategies and interest-rate-hedging strategies continue to exhibit strong performance. The article concludes that a diverse suite of strategies, including income ETFs and gold, are available for investors.

title: Elon Musk's X hit with trademark lawsuit from marketing agency
summary: X Corp, formerly Twitter, is facing a trademark infringement lawsuit from a legal-marketing company called X Social Media. The Florida-based company claims that X Corp's rebranding is causing consumer confusion and has led to lost revenue, given their prior use and federal trademark for "X Social Media" since 2016. This lawsuit is potentially the first of many such disputes due to the common use of the letter "X" in tech branding.

title: Supermicro At 30: From Designing AI Chips To Selling AI Systems
summary: Supermicro, founded 30 years ago, began with Charles Liang's vision to improve server motherboards and power supplies after working on an AI processor design. The company has grown into a $10 billion systems business with global manufacturing facilities and aims for $20 billion in the next three years, continuously expanding its operations and exploring new factory locations.

title: Communications ETF XLC Offers Loud & Clear Exposure to the Space
summary: The Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLC) provides investors with exposure to the growing digital side of the U.S. economy, encompassing communications, media, and technology companies. Launched following a 2018 GICS reclassification, XLC tracks a market-cap-weighted index of U.S. telecom, media, and entertainment components of the S&P 500, with top holdings including Meta Platforms and Alphabet. This ETF offers an accessible and low-cost way to invest in leading digital economy companies.

title: Instacart Pops 12% On Nasdaq Debut: 6 ETFs in Focus
summary: Instacart's shares (CART) made their Nasdaq debut with a 12% increase, though this gain was short-lived. The company's IPO valued it at nearly $9.9 billion, significantly less than its 2021 valuation. The article also highlights six ETFs that could be in focus following Instacart's market debut, offering diversified exposure to the IPO market or related sectors.

title: Qualcomm, Meta Platforms rise; J.M. Smucker, RTX fall, Monday, 9/11/2023
summary: This article details the stock performance of several companies on Monday, September 11, 2023. Qualcomm and Meta Platforms saw their stock prices rise due to specific company news, while J.M. Smucker and RTX experienced declines following significant announcements. Other notable movers include Alibaba, FuelCell Energy, Carlisle Cos., and Freeport-McMoRan.

title: Breakthrough and Enovis (TM) Announce Official Partnership, Empowering Private Practice Healthcare to Help Improve Quality of Care While Increasing Profitability
summary: Breakthrough, a leader in conservative care marketing solutions, and Enovis™ Corporation, a pioneer in innovative rehabilitation technologies, have announced an official partnership. This collaboration aims to empower private practice healthcare providers to improve patient care quality and increase profitability by promoting innovative therapeutic technologies directly to patients through data-driven marketing campaigns. The partnership enables clinics to confidently adopt new technologies, like laser therapy, by offering solutions to overcome declining insurance reimbursements through cash-based services.

title: YieldMax Launches Option Income Strategy ETF on Coinbase
summary: YieldMax has launched the YieldMax COIN Option Income Strategy ETF (CONY) on NYSE Arca, aiming to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on Coinbase Global (COIN). This ETF, actively managed by ZEGA Financial, is part of a growing suite of YieldMax option income strategy ETFs focusing on growth companies that may not pay dividends. It provides investors with an opportunity to earn income and potentially protect against downside while gaining exposure to a growth company like Coinbase.

title: AI as an investment theme
summary: The article discusses Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a significant investment theme due to its potential to revolutionize industries and create new opportunities. It highlights the booming AI sector, strong investor interest, and the impact of AI on technology stocks and the broader market. The author also touches upon various ways to invest in AI, including specific ETFs, and emphasizes the importance of careful research despite the vast potential.

title: PhishForce: New phishing attack involving Salesforce and Facebook uncovered
summary: Security researchers at Guardio Labs have uncovered a new, sophisticated phishing attack dubbed "PhishForce" targeting Salesforce customers. This attack cleverly spoofs Salesforce email servers and domain names and uses legitimate email gateways to hide malicious emails that redirect users to phishing pages designed to steal Facebook account details. Both Salesforce and Facebook have been notified and have taken steps to address the vulnerability.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 07/30/2023
summary: This article details the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending July 30, 2023, highlighting that these funds are high-risk due to leverage. Key performers include China-focused ETFs like Direxion Daily FTSE China Bull 3X Shares (YINN) and Direxion Daily CSI China Internet Index Bull 2x Shares (CWEB), along with those tracking electric vehicles (EVAV) and specific tech giants like Meta (FBL) and Google (GGLL). The performance was driven by factors such as China's policy actions, growth in the EV sector, and strong tech earnings.

title: The Advisors Guide to Using NSPL to Enhance Portfolios
summary: This article explains how the NightShares 500 1x/1.5x ETF (NSPL) can enhance investment portfolios by capturing the "night effect," a historical market pattern where overnight trading sessions contribute most of the returns and less volatility. By leveraging this effect, NSPL aims to provide improved risk-adjusted returns, as demonstrated by its favorable Sharpe ratio compared to traditional S&P 500 exposure. The ETF's strategy is designed to capture overnight gains without missing daytime performance.

title: AI and Data Centers: It’s About Keeping Cool
summary: A report from Citi Research highlights the critical role data centers play in the AI revolution, emphasizing that keeping servers cool will be vital. Despite historical predictions, data center energy use has been largely stable due to efficiency gains, but AI's computational demands are accelerating, making cooling and renewable energy increasingly important for sustainability. The article notes that while AI compute has outpaced Moore's Law, increased scrutiny of carbon emissions will drive higher corporate renewable PPAs.

title: YieldMax Launches Synthetic Covered Call ETFs for Meta, Google
summary: YieldMax has introduced two new actively managed ETFs, the YieldMax META Option Income Strategy ETF (FBY) and the YieldMax GOOGL Option Income Strategy ETF (GOOY), designed to generate monthly income through synthetic covered call strategies on Meta and Alphabet stock, respectively. These ETFs, which do not directly invest in the underlying stocks, follow the recent launch of the YieldMax AMZN Option Income Strategy ETF (AMZY) and cater to increasing advisor interest in options-based income strategies. Both new funds carry an expense ratio of 0.99% and are advised by Tidal Financial Group and subadvised by ZEGA Financial.

title: YieldMax Launches Synthetic Covered Call ETFs for Meta, Google
summary: YieldMax has expanded its lineup of actively managed ETFs by launching two new funds that employ a synthetic covered call strategy for Meta Platforms Inc. (META) and Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL). The YieldMax META Option Income Strategy ETF (FBY) and the YieldMax GOOGL Option Income Strategy ETF (GOOY) aim to generate monthly income by selling call options on these tech giants. These new offerings follow the recent introduction of a similar ETF for Amazon (AMZN) and all have an expense ratio of 0.99%.

title: ETFs to Tap on Meta's Blowout Q2 Earnings
summary: Meta Platforms (META) reported strong Q2 2023 results, exceeding revenue and earnings estimates, driven by AI and marking its first double-digit revenue growth since 2021. This article suggests investors consider ETFs with significant META allocation, highlighting specific communication services and tech-focused ETFs. The strong performance led to a 7.5% share spike in aftermarket hours, and the company issued upbeat revenue guidance for the current quarter.

title: Why is Netflix lagging FAANG stocks?
summary: While other FAANG stocks have seen significant rallies in 2023, Netflix has lagged, raising questions about its inclusion in the group. Despite a subscriber boost from a password crackdown, the company faces challenges from ongoing strikes and has not highlighted AI in its earnings, unlike its tech counterparts. The article discusses investment approaches for FAANG stocks through ETFs.

title: How will the metaverse change our lives?
summary: This article explores the concept of the metaverse, its origins, and its potential impact on our lives, particularly within financial services. It delves into how the metaverse, driven by emerging technologies like Augmented Reality and Blockchain, could revolutionize banking with new e-commerce experiences and personalized financial assistance. The author also discusses the challenges and considerations, such as identity and fraud prevention, that need to be addressed as the metaverse develops.

title: Caribbean phone companies suffering from “market failure” due to Over-The Top services, Social Media
summary: Caribbean telecommunication companies are experiencing "market failure" due to the prevalent use of Over-The-Top (OTT) services and social media, which consume the majority of data and international call traffic, leading to significant financial losses for local providers. Despite annual investments exceeding US$500 million in network upgrades since 2017, these companies face declining voice revenues and a lack of significant contribution from major tech companies that utilize their infrastructure. Industry leaders are advocating for government intervention and a unified CARICOM approach to address this imbalance and ensure a fair share from big tech, warning of dire consequences for regional connectivity and economic development if the issue remains unresolved.

title: An End to Regulatory Risk in China’s Internet Sector
summary: Recent meetings between Premier Li Qiang and heads of major Chinese internet companies signal an end to a period of regulatory crackdown in the sector, turning a significant investor headwind into a tailwind. This shift, marked by commitments to transparency and growth support, is seen as paving the way for more sustainable development in China’s internet economy. Investors are looking to capture this potential growth through instruments like the KraneShares CSI China Internet ETF (KWEB), which tracks key Chinese tech companies.

title: Cisco bats for universal AI regulation
summary: Cisco is advocating for universal AI regulation, emphasizing the need for a global public-private dialogue due to AI's far-reaching impact. The company believes AI should be used responsibly with transparency and collaboration between the public and private sectors to establish regulatory frameworks, including content attribution and copyright. This stance aligns with other tech giants like Microsoft and Google who also support AI regulation, and comes as the EU is actively pursuing legislation in this area.

title: TThe High Price of Low Volatility | U.S. Equity market commentary 2Q23
summary: This article by Bill Nygren, Portfolio Manager at Oakmark, discusses how different entities define investment risk and argues against the common perception of index funds as low-risk, highlighting increasing concentration risk in indices like the NASDAQ 100 and S&P 500. He contrasts this with Oakmark's approach, which focuses on long-term value investing and accepts higher short-term volatility for potentially better long-term returns. Nygren contends that index fund investors and those seeking low volatility stocks are overlooking significant valuation risks.

title: Some ESG Issues Take Center Stage at Big Tech Investor Meetings
summary: ESG principles are increasingly important at big tech companies, with shareholder demands evolving beyond traditional environmental concerns to focus on social and governance issues. Recent investor meetings at Alphabet and Meta, both holdings in the Invesco ESG Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQMG), saw a rise in shareholder resolutions concerning online safety, gender/racial equity, human rights, and executive compensation. This trend highlights the growing emphasis on the "S" and "G" in ESG, potentially positioning QQMG as a relevant investment for those seeking exposure to mega-cap growth with an ESG focus.

title: With a New Developer Framework, Building in XR is Easier than Ever for the Spatial Computing Revolution
authors: G/O Media Studios for Qualcomm Inc.
summary: Qualcomm is making significant strides in the Extended Reality (XR) space with its Snapdragon Spaces™ XR Developer Platform, aiming to simplify development for immersive experiences. Hugo Swart, Qualcomm's VP and GM of XR, highlights the new "Dual Render Fusion" feature which allows developers to convert 2D smartphone apps into AR Glass-capable experiences, lowering the barrier to entry for many. The company envisions an "spatial internet" where XR devices will eventually replace smartphones and PCs for most computing tasks, transforming industries from training and education to social interaction and entertainment.

title: $9B Momentum ETF Is Unrecognizable After Makeover
summary: The iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM), valued at $9 billion, has undergone a significant rebalancing, dramatically changing its top holdings and tilting heavily towards technology stocks. This makeover has raised questions about whether the fund is too late to capitalize on the recent tech rally, especially given its recent underperformance compared to the broader market. Despite recent struggles and outflows, MTUM is still a substantial ETF, and its future performance hinges on the durability of current market trends, particularly in technology.

title: Right-wing investment fund dumps Target stock over ‘woke’ agenda, adds retailer to ‘refuse to buy’ list
summary: The American Conservative Values ETF (ACVF) has divested its holdings in Target Corp. and added the retailer to its "Refuse to Buy" list, citing the company's "woke" agenda and its handling of Pride merchandising. ACVF criticized Target's "ever-increasing pandering to the Woke LGBT agenda," stating that it has damaged the brand and will likely harm its long-term stock performance. This move comes as Target faces backlash from both conservatives and liberals regarding its LGBTQ+ merchandise displays and subsequent actions.

title: Google announces US-Taiwan-Philippines cable with Chunghwa, Globe, and AT&T
summary: Google has announced plans for a new subsea cable system, TPU (Taiwan-Philippines-US), linking the US, Taiwan, and the Philippines, partnering with Chunghwa Telecom, Innove (Globe Group), and AT&T. This new cable, expected to be ready for service in 2025 with NEC as the supplier, will provide 260Tbps of capacity and offer an alternative route to Google's existing Apricot cable, enhancing resilience and capacity in the APAC region. Additionally, the article notes another subsea cable development, the EMC West system in the Middle East, being built by Center3 and ASN.

title: ETF of the Week: Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP)
summary: VettaFi’s Tom Lydon discusses the Goldman Sachs Hedge Industry VIP ETF (GVIP) which offers exposure to top holdings favored by hedge funds without an overweight toward any single stock. GVIP provides diversification across various companies, including some mid-cap and international stocks, making it a less volatile option for investors seeking innovative companies. It provides a consensus of top companies chosen by leading hedge fund managers, appealing to investors looking for strong, well-vetted companies.

title: Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FDIG)
summary: The Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF (FDIG) invests in companies related to cryptocurrency, blockchain, and digital payments. Since the beginning of 2025, FDIG shares have increased by 35.3% and are currently trading at $43.96. The ETF has assets under management of $291.65 million and a net expense ratio of 0.40%.

title: FTC Sues to Block Amgen’s Acquisition of Horizon Therapeutics
summary: The FTC is suing to block Amgen's $27.8 billion acquisition of Horizon Therapeutics, citing concerns that it could create a monopoly in the market for critical thyroid eye disease and chronic refractory gout treatments. The agency believes Amgen could leverage its existing drug portfolio to pressure healthcare providers and insurers into favoring Horizon's drugs, Tepezza and Krystexxa, which currently face no market competition. Amgen has expressed disappointment but remains committed to completing the acquisition, asserting it will benefit patients with rare diseases.

title: Peter Thiel's Palantir Sees Skyrocketing Demand for AI Technologies: What Its CEO Has to Say
authors: Keith Noonan for The Motley Fool
summary: Palantir is experiencing skyrocketing demand for its new Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP), leading to a significant stock increase after strong Q1 results. CEO Alex Karp and co-founder Peter Thiel are highly confident in Palantir's AI leadership, believing the market underestimates their progress and their strategy to dominate the AI market by creating value for hundreds of customers. The company aims for profitability on a GAAP basis throughout the rest of the year.

title: 40 Under 40: Champions of Construction 2022
summary: This article celebrates Autodesk's 40 Under 40: Champions of Construction for 2022, highlighting 40 individuals who are making significant contributions to the construction industry through innovation, leadership, and digital transformation. It details their roles, achievements, and impact on their respective companies and the broader AEC sector. The honorees are recognized for advancing digital maturity, implementing new technologies, and fostering collaborative and sustainable practices.

title: 2 Invesco ETFs That Offer Meta Exposure
summary: As Meta Platforms Inc. shares surge, two Invesco ETFs—the Invesco NASDAQ Internet ETF (PNQI) and the Invesco Dynamic Media ETF (PBS)—offer significant exposure to the company. Meta is the top holding in both ETFs, with weights of 9.1% and 6.6% respectively. Investors looking to capitalize on Meta's strong performance and broader internet or media sectors may consider these funds.

title: Introducing Jim Squires, EVP of Business Marketing and Growth, and New Orgs
summary: Reddit announced the appointment of Jim Squires as EVP of Business Marketing and Growth, who will report to COO Jen Wong and focus on expanding Reddit's Ads Business and international advertiser footprint. Concurrently, Roxy Young's role evolved to Chief Marketing and Consumer Experience Officer, reporting directly to CEO Steve Huffman, to lead a new "CX" organization encompassing Community, Communications, and Creative to elevate Reddit's unique community aspect. These changes aim to strengthen Reddit's market presence and innovative advertising solutions while furthering its community-driven marketing strategy.

title: Accenture is cutting 75 San Jose workers
summary: Accenture is cutting 75 employees based at Google's campus in North San Jose, appearing to be cutting contractors who worked for Google. This news comes amidst a wave of other major layoffs by tech companies including First Republic, Google, Lyft, and Meta Platforms.

title: Undervalued Communication Services Stocks
summary: This article identifies undervalued communication services stocks, highlighting names like Comcast, Disney, and Alphabet, which are trading at discounts after a challenging 2022. It screens for companies within the Morningstar US Communication Services Index that have a 4 or 5-star Morningstar Rating and a wide economic moat, providing analyst insights for the top five. The communication services sector saw a significant rebound in early 2023 after substantial losses in the previous year.

title: Ibex Global Solutions closing San Antonio call center, affecting 227 employees
summary: Ibex Global Solutions is closing its San Antonio call center in June, impacting 227 employees. Most workers will be offered positions at the company's New Braunfels call center or the option to work from home. This closure is part of a larger trend of layoffs in the region, with Ibex shifting operations to offshore and nearshore locations.

title: What's Cognyte, the spyware Congress alleges the government is buying
summary: The article discusses allegations by the Indian Congress party that the Modi government is planning to acquire new spyware from an Israeli company called Cognyte, costing Rs 986 crore. This comes after a previous controversy involving Pegasus spyware. Cognyte, an investigative analytics software company, has faced accusations of using fake profiles to gather private data and has been dropped by Norway's sovereign wealth fund due to alleged human rights violations by its client states.

title: Best-Performing Stocks of Q1 2023
summary: The first quarter of 2023 saw a significant rebound in technology and communication services stocks, with Nvidia, Meta Platforms, and Salesforce among the top performers. This resurgence was driven by factors such as better-than-expected earnings, cost-cutting measures, and growing enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, contrasting sharply with the downturn experienced in 2022. Other sectors like entertainment and media, cryptocurrency, and electric vehicles also saw notable gains.

title: Digital Economy Discovers a Potential Frontier for Growth Thanks to Generative AI
summary: Generative AI, exemplified by large language models like GPT-3, is revolutionizing artificial intelligence, offering significant leaps in capabilities, speed, and cost-effectiveness. This new wave of AI is poised to drive massive innovation, boosting productivity and creating new applications across various sectors. The article explores how this technology will particularly impact and create opportunities in cloud computing, cybersecurity, and digital media, leading to substantial investment and growth in these areas.

title: News | Salesforce Seeks To Offload Large Block of Office Space in New Chicago Tower
summary: Salesforce is looking to sublease up to 125,000 square feet of its office space in the new 60-story Salesforce Tower in Chicago, citing recent job cuts and a desire to reduce real estate holdings. This move aligns with a broader trend of companies, including Meta, reducing their office footprints post-pandemic, while also highlighting the "flight to quality" as tenants seek premium spaces. The sublease offering is expected to attract high demand, given the limited availability of large, quality office spaces along the Chicago River.

title: How Does RSPE Compare to RSP?
summary: This article compares the Invesco ESG S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSPE) with the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), highlighting their shared equal-weight methodology and RSPE's additional ESG screening. It notes that while RSPE has fewer holdings due to ESG exclusions, all its holdings are found in RSP, with RSPE outperforming the S&P 500 in 2022. The article provides specific examples of securities screened out of RSPE that are present in RSP.

title: Tech leaders from Vimeo, Slack, and 776 share insights on staying innovative during an economic downturn
summary: During a panel at SXSW, tech leaders from Vimeo, Slack, and 776 discussed strategies for innovation amidst economic turbulence, including recent layoffs and the Silicon Valley Bank collapse. They emphasized the importance of focusing on customer needs, transparent communication, and maintaining employee morale through difficult periods. The panelists concluded that constraints often foster innovation, leading to the creation of valuable new products and services.

title: News | Salesforce Executive Calls In-Office Work Critical to Tech Giant’s Profitability
summary: Salesforce's Chief Operating Officer Brian Millham states that in-person work is crucial for the company's future growth and profitability, reversing a previous stance on remote work. He noted a drop in productivity among remote employees during the pandemic. The company's shift back to a hybrid model, requiring sales and service employees in the office four days a week, appears to be positively impacting revenue growth.

title: Growth stock vs. value stock? It's all in the eye of the beholder
summary: The article discusses the increasingly blurred lines between growth and value stocks, particularly in the context of index investing. It highlights how major index providers like S&P reclassify stocks such as Microsoft and ExxonMobil, challenging traditional definitions due to factors like price momentum and earnings changes. The piece emphasizes that different index construction methodologies and rebalancing schedules can lead to significant performance divergences among growth and value ETFs, urging investors to understand what criteria their investments are based on.

title: The U.S. Stock Market Is Undervalued, but It Looks Like a Rough Road Ahead
summary: The U.S. stock market remains undervalued for long-term investors, but economic and monetary headwinds are expected to slow gains in the first half of the year. While the economy has been more resilient than expected, tightening monetary policy will nevertheless take its toll, pushing a potential economic slowdown to Q3 and Q4 2023. Investors are advised to focus on undervalued stocks tied to long-term secular growth themes during market volatility.

title: Entravision Announced as the Authorized Sales Partner of Meta in Mongolia
summary: Entravision (NYSE: EVC) has announced that its Asia-based digital business unit has become the Authorized Sales Partner of Meta in Mongolia. This partnership aims to connect brands to consumers through local strategic support, creative expertise, and in-market training, empowering local businesses with advanced advertising solutions. Entravision will provide a dedicated local team, strategic direction, support, training, lines of credit, and local billing to advertisers in Mongolia to help them achieve their business objectives.

title: SMOT ETF: Question & Answer
summary: This article addresses frequently asked questions about investing in SMID-cap stocks, Morningstar's forward-looking research, and the VanEck Morningstar SMID Moat ETF (SMOT). It highlights the compelling return potential and diversification benefits of SMID-cap stocks while acknowledging their associated risks. The article also explains how SMOT leverages Morningstar's research to target companies with competitive advantages and attractive valuations, making it a suitable option for long-term satellite or short-term tactical allocations.

title: This Week in the Metaverse: BlackRock's new ETF, Titanic artifacts as NFTs, and a Snow Crash Sotheby’s auction
summary: BlackRock has launched a new metaverse ETF, allowing investors to engage with companies contributing to virtual platforms, gaming, and AR/VR. In other news, never-before-seen photos of rapper Tupac Shakur are being released as NFTs, while artifacts from the Titanic will also be preserved and sold as NFTs. Additionally, Sotheby's is holding an auction to celebrate 30 years of Neal Stephenson's "Snow Crash," featuring physical and digital items tied to the seminal metaverse novel.

title: Baidu's ChatGPT-like app will revolutionise its search engine, says CEO
summary: Baidu's CEO Robin Li announced that its upcoming ChatGPT-like app, Ernie Bot, will revolutionize its search engine by enhancing user experience and engagement, significantly expanding the market size of search engines. The company plans to build an AI ecosystem around Ernie Bot, leveraging its advanced generative AI technology to boost online advertising and serve as a productivity tool for other businesses. Baidu aims to regain market share and capitalize on its "first mover" advantage in China's AI market with Ernie Bot, which is trained on years of search data and is "state of the art" in understanding Chinese language and culture.

title: Software company Autodesk lays off 250 employees
summary: Autodesk, a software company, has laid off 250 employees, which is less than 2% of its global workforce. This decision is part of its fiscal year 2024 plans to align resources with key priorities and comes amidst a global economic downturn affecting many tech companies. The affected roles include digital marketing, technical marketing, and web optimization, though the company continues to hire for other key positions.

title: HubSpot, Pinterest Add to Tech Layoff Chaos
summary: HubSpot and Pinterest have joined other major tech companies in announcing layoffs, with Pinterest cutting 150 employees (less than 5% of its workforce) and HubSpot letting go of around 500 staff (7% of its total workforce). These cuts reflect a continuing trend of mass layoffs in the tech sector due to a tumultuous 2022 and an uncertain economic climate, with over 82,000 tech workers laid off since the beginning of the year. Companies are implementing various cost-cutting measures, but the stream of layoffs is expected to continue for some time.

title: Dow Chemical to cut 2,000 jobs
summary: Dow Chemical announced Thursday it will cut approximately 2,000 jobs from its workforce as part of a plan to achieve $1 billion in cost savings in 2023. The company has been battling soaring energy costs following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and reported a 17% drop in net sales during the fourth quarter of 2022. This move aligns with a trend of major corporations, particularly in the tech industry, implementing mass layoffs recently.

title: AMD can keep eating Intel’s lunch, Barclays says as stock surges
summary: Barclays upgraded AMD's stock to overweight from equal weight, leading to a more than 6% surge in AMD shares. Analyst Blayne Curtis believes AMD's Genoa and Bergamo platforms will enable further market-share gains against Intel. The upgrade also suggests AMD could benefit from Meta reaccelerating its spending.

title: AMC class action claims streaming service shares viewer data with Facebook
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against AMC+ alleging that the streaming service shared subscribers' personal information and viewing history with Facebook without their consent. The lawsuit claims AMC+ used the Facebook Pixel tool to collect data, violating the Video Privacy Protection Act (VPPA) and New York consumer protection laws. Plaintiffs are seeking an injunction, damages, and a jury trial for themselves and other affected AMC+ users.

title: Israel's Cognyte won tender to sell intercept spyware to Myanmar before coup -documents
summary: Documents reviewed by Reuters indicate that Israel's Cognyte won a tender to sell intercept spyware to a state-backed telecommunications firm in Myanmar a month before the February 2021 military coup. This deal occurred despite Israel's claims of having stopped defense technology transfers to Myanmar following a 2017 Supreme Court ruling, leading to a legal complaint calling for a criminal investigation into Cognyte and government officials. The spyware allows authorities to monitor communications and track locations, raising significant human rights concerns, especially given Myanmar's post-coup human rights record.

title: How to Find Stocks Poised to Outperform
summary: The article explains that combining wide economic moats with low valuations has consistently led to market outperformance over the long term, even during bear markets. It highlights how Morningstar's Wide Moat Focus Index, consisting of undervalued companies with strong competitive advantages, has significantly outperformed broader market and wide moat composite indexes over decades. The success is attributed to the combination of high quality, stable prices, and attractive valuations, leading to long-term gains despite potential underperformance in bull markets.

title: SoundHound axes nearly 50% of staff less than a year after IPO
summary: SoundHound, a speech and music recognition company, laid off nearly half of its remaining staff less than a year after its IPO. The company cited changing economic conditions and continued to book losses in Q3 2022 despite increased revenue. This move follows an earlier 10% staff reduction and comes amid widespread job cuts in the tech industry.

title: A Brutal Year in the Markets Doesn’t Rattle ETF Investors
summary: Despite a brutal year for the markets in 2022, U.S. Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) still attracted significant inflows of $597.9 billion, ranking as the second-highest annual sum on record. Fixed-income ETFs showed strong organic growth, attracting $196.4 billion as investors sought safety. Vanguard maintained its lead in annual inflows for the third consecutive year, while active ETFs also gained market share, notably led by JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI).

title: Goldman junior bankers are publicly threatening to leave Wall Street for tech as CEO demands full-time return to office
summary: Junior bankers at Goldman Sachs are expressing significant discontent over CEO David Solomon's mandate for a full-time return to the office, publicly threatening to leave for tech companies offering more flexibility. This comes despite increased bonuses and new benefits aimed at retaining talent, as the bank emphasizes an apprenticeship culture and the benefits of in-person collaboration. The move highlights a growing clash between traditional financial institutions' return-to-office policies and employees' desire for hybrid work arrangements.

title: Cloudflare didn’t want cybersecurity companies silencing speech. Anti-trans trolls took advantage of the generosity
summary: Cloudflare initially defended its stance against deplatforming Kiwi Farms, a forum known for harassing marginalized communities, arguing against becoming an arbiter of online content. However, due to escalating threats targeting human life, Cloudflare reversed its decision and blocked Kiwi Farms, highlighting the difficult balance cybersecurity providers face between free speech principles and safety. This incident, following prior actions against 8chan and Daily Stormer, underscores the complex challenges internet infrastructure companies encounter in navigating content moderation without clear legislative guidelines.

title: HP Inc. is cutting up to 6,000 employees as it becomes the latest tech company to announce major layoffs
summary: HP Inc. announced plans to lay off between 4,000 and 6,000 employees over the next three years, representing nearly 10% of its workforce. This decision is part of a cost-cutting strategy amidst declining sales, an 11.2% drop in fourth-quarter revenue to $14.8 billion, and a challenging economic environment exacerbated by high inflation and interest rates. The company expects the restructuring to save $1.4 billion annually by the end of fiscal year 2025, with costs estimated at $1 billion.

title: Class members oppose Meta’s $725M Cambridge Analytica data-harvesting settlement
summary: Class members are opposing Meta's $725 million settlement related to the Cambridge Analytica data scandal, arguing that the proposed compensation scheme is unfair. Two class members filed objections, stating that users with more Facebook friends, who faced greater risk of data exposure, should receive higher compensation than those with fewer friends. The settlement, which covers U.S. Facebook users between May 2007 and December 2022, aims to resolve claims that Facebook shared user data with third parties without consent.

title: Folgers, La-Z-Boy, American Girl face class actions alleging companies share data with Facebook
summary: La-Z-Boy, American Girl, and Folgers are facing separate class-action lawsuits alleging they illegally share website visitor data, including identities and media viewing activities, with Facebook. The lawsuits claim the companies embed a Facebook tracking Pixel on their websites to collect and transmit user data, violating the Video Privacy Protection Act to help Facebook create targeted advertisements. Plaintiff Keith Carroll is seeking to represent a nationwide class of consumers whose personally identifiable information was disclosed to Facebook without consent, demanding a jury trial, declaratory and injunctive relief, and damages.

title: $90M Class Action Settlement Approved for Facebook Despite Objections
summary: A $90 million class action settlement against Meta Platforms, Inc. (formerly Facebook, Inc.) has been approved despite objections regarding its sufficiency. The settlement resolves a lawsuit alleging unlawful tracking of user information when users were logged out, with $26.1 million designated for attorney fees and approximately $39.21 per class member for 1,558,805 valid claims. The platform giant was also ordered to delete "wrongfully collected" data.

title: Facebook parent Meta to settle Cambridge Analytica scandal case for $725 million
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has agreed to pay $725 million to settle a class-action lawsuit alleging the company illegally shared user data with third parties, including Cambridge Analytica. This proposed settlement, disclosed in a court filing, is the largest ever in a U.S. data privacy class action and resolves a long-running lawsuit stemming from 2018 revelations about Facebook's data access policies. The company, while not admitting wrongdoing, stated the settlement is "in the best interest of our community and shareholders" and covers an estimated 250 to 280 million Facebook users.

title: 'WHAT… HAPPENED'? A look back on crypto's 'biggest year yet' (for fraud, hacks, implosions…)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive look back at the tumultuous year 2022 for the cryptocurrency market, detailing significant events such as major frauds, hacks, and implosions of key platforms and stablecoins. It covers a month-by-month breakdown of happenings, including initial high hopes for adoption, the Terra/LUNA collapse, the "Great Crypto Contagion" of June, the Ethereum Merge, and the eventual downfall of FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried. The author questions the common prediction of a "builders" year ahead, suggesting a contrarian outcome may still be possible.

title: Where Are Stocks Looking Cheap or Expensive?
summary: After a significant valuation reset in 2022, Morningstar analysts believe the stock market is finishing the year at its most undervalued level since March 2020. Small-cap and large-cap growth stocks, as well as sectors like communication services and consumer cyclicals, appear significantly undervalued, while utilities, oil and gas, and waste management remain relatively overvalued. This analysis is based on price/fair value ratios, with US stocks trading at an average 15% discount as of December 19, 2022.

title: Will WhatsApp Partnership Boost MercadoLibre’s Earnings?
summary: MercadoLibre's stock has trended lower in 2022, but a new partnership with Meta Platforms' WhatsApp for payment processing in Brazil could provide a significant boost. The e-commerce specialist is testing payment processing for business users on WhatsApp, aiming for a seamless checkout experience. Despite strong earnings and revenue growth, MercadoLibre has recently missed earnings views, and the stock is working on its fifth consecutive week of declines, suggesting it still needs to stage a rally to become a less risky investment.

title: GraniteShares goes live with three leveraged single stock ETFs on NASDAQ
summary: GraniteShares has launched three new leveraged single-stock ETFs on the NASDAQ Stock Exchange, offering sophisticated investors 1.5x to 1.75x long exposure to Meta, Alibaba, and Nvidia. This expansion builds on GraniteShares' existing leveraged ETF offerings for Tesla, Coinbase, and Apple and aims to make leveraged single-company exposure, previously confined to specialists, accessible to a broader range of investors. Having pioneered the single-stock ETF market in Europe, GraniteShares is now bringing its expertise and popular product range to the U.S. market.

title: Meta wins $365K against Hong Kong social media company over data scraping
summary: Meta has won a default judgment of $365,000 against Hong Kong social media company Social Data Trading Ltd. for illicitly scraping data from over 90 million Instagram user profiles. The lawsuit, filed in a California federal court, alleged that the company used bots to collect publicly viewable information and sold it as "insights and data." The court also issued an injunction against Social Data Trading, prohibiting it from accessing Meta's platforms or selling any data purportedly obtained from them.

title: Check out GraniteShares 2x Long META Daily ETF's stock price (FBL) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock price and key financial data for the GraniteShares 2x Long META Daily ETF (FBL). It includes details such as current trading prices, daily high/low, 52-week range, volume, and other key stats. The content is presented by CNBC, aiming to keep investors informed about FBL's market performance.

title: BlackRock seeks to capitalise on metaverse through new ETF
summary: BlackRock has launched a new exchange-traded fund (ETF) called iShare Metaverse UCITS to allow European clients exposure to companies developing metaverse technologies. This ETF tracks the STOXX Global Metaverse Index, which identifies market leaders and innovators through patent data analysis. The initiative aims to capitalize on the rapidly growing metaverse market, predicted to reach US$4-5 trillion by 2030, offering investors a diversified portfolio in this emerging technological space.

title: Pfizer to invest over $1.26 billion in Irish jobs boost
summary: Pfizer Inc. plans to invest over 1.2 billion euros ($1.26 billion) to expand its manufacturing plant in Dublin, creating 400 to 500 new jobs and doubling the capacity for biological drug substances. This significant investment is Pfizer's largest in Ireland to date, bringing its total staffing in the country to 5,500, amidst a period where other tech companies are laying off staff. The expansion will support the production of non-COVID licensed and pipeline products, further enhancing the site's capabilities.

title: Salesforce shares tumble after surprise exit of co-CEO Taylor
summary: Salesforce Inc (CRM.N) shares fell by about 10% after co-CEO Bret Taylor's unexpected departure, raising concerns about the company's co-CEO leadership model and slowing revenue growth. This exit prompted at least 17 brokerages to cut their price targets on the stock, with analysts noting it as a significant blow given Taylor's leadership role in product development. Taylor's departure comes after just one year in the co-CEO role, leaving co-founder Marc Benioff as the sole top boss.

title: Yahoo to buy minority stake in Taboola in digital ad push
summary: Yahoo is set to acquire a nearly 25% minority stake in Taboola.com Ltd, making it the largest shareholder. This 30-year deal will grant Taboola exclusive rights to sell native ads on Yahoo's platforms and is projected to generate $1 billion in annual revenue, marking a significant push into digital advertising for Yahoo. The agreement aims to boost Taboola's revenue and operating earnings, despite a recent downturn in its quarterly revenue and annual forecast.

title: These 2 ETFs show why owning small-cap stocks is key to beating the market at times like this
summary: Small-cap stocks within the S&P 500 have significantly outperformed larger-cap stocks this year, with the eight largest market cap stocks experiencing an average loss of 40.4% compared to a 9.5% average loss for the remaining stocks. This highlights how an equal-weight strategy can be more beneficial for S&P 500 investors when the biggest names are struggling. The article suggests that owning small-cap stocks is crucial for beating the market in such conditions.

title: U-Haul diversifies its social strategy to tell people it’s more than moving trucks
summary: U-Haul is expanding its social media strategy across various platforms like TikTok, LinkedIn, and Pinterest to communicate that it offers more than just moving trucks, including storage lockers, boxes, and hitches. This diversification aims to build brand loyalty and awareness among a broad customer base, leveraging digital channels after significantly reducing print advertising spend in 2009. While spending on social media is difficult to track precisely, U-Haul's overall advertising spend increased significantly from 2021 to 2022, with a notable portion dedicated to streaming and desktop video.

title: 20 Instagram Reel ideas for all types of brands
summary: This article provides 20 diverse Instagram Reel ideas tailored for various types of brands, including fashion and retail, higher education, B2B companies, government agencies, nonprofits, travel/tourism, and healthcare. It emphasizes the importance of short-form video content for engagement on Instagram and offers specific examples and strategies for each industry to create effective Reels. The suggestions range from showcasing products and brand values to engaging students, promoting events, and using trending sounds or ASMR.

title: Astera Labs Accelerates Company Growth with Series-D Funding and Expanded Board of Directors
summary: Astera Labs announced significant company growth, including closing a $150M Series-D funding round led by Fidelity Management & Research, which raised its valuation to $3.15B. The company also expanded its Board of Directors with Dr. Alexis Black Bjorlin of Meta and Michael Hurlston of Synaptics, and grew its product portfolio with the Leo Memory Connectivity Platform for CXL™. These milestones, alongside global expansion with new R&D centers in Canada, position Astera Labs for continued leadership in connectivity solutions for intelligent systems.

title: Astera Labs raises $150M to boost connectivity for intelligent systems
summary: Astera Labs has successfully closed a $150 million Series D funding round, bringing its valuation to $3.15 billion. The semiconductor design firm specializes in connectivity solutions for intelligent systems, critical for emerging AI and machine learning workloads in data centers. The company also announced an expanded board of directors and a new product, the Leo CXL Memory Connectivity Platform, to enhance application performance.

title: JPMorgan Chase chief Jamie Dimon bullish on Austin despite economic uncertainty
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon visited Austin, reasserting the bank's commitment to expansion in the city and Texas despite economic uncertainties and a projected recession. JPMorgan Chase is growing its Austin workforce by 10% and leasing additional office space, contrasting with other tech firms that are retrenching. Dimon expressed concern about global geopolitical factors but indicated he is not worried about a housing market crash similar to 2008.

title: Crypto, unicorns and housing bubbles: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon talks economy in Austin
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon visited Austin to discuss the economy, the implosion of FTX, and the future of banking. Dimon expressed optimism for Austin's future due to its pro-business environment and growth potential. He emphasized Texas's attractiveness for business and job creation.

title: Intuit Secretly Shares TurboTax, QuickBooks Subscribers’ Info with Facebook, Class Action Claims
summary: A class action lawsuit alleges that Intuit secretly disclosed the identities and video-viewing habits of its TurboTax and QuickBooks subscribers to Facebook without their consent. The lawsuit claims Intuit violated the federal Video Privacy Protection Act (VPPA) by using a "Facebook tracking pixel" to send users' personal information and video activity, including their Facebook ID, to Meta. This alleged data sharing purportedly benefits both Facebook through targeted ads and Intuit through advertising and information services.

title: Facebook $90 mln privacy settlement approved over antitrust lawyers' objection
summary: A California federal judge has approved a $90 million privacy settlement for Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc., despite objections from antitrust lawyers who argued the broad terms could jeopardize their separate antitrust case. The judge also upheld an award of $26 million in legal fees for the privacy case. The privacy settlement resolves claims that Facebook tracked users' web activity while logged out.

title: Dow pops 1,200 points, S&P 500 jumps 5% in biggest rally in two years after light inflation report
summary: Stocks experienced their largest rally since 2020 following an October consumer price index report that suggested inflation might have peaked. The Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 1,201.43 points (3.7%), the S&P 500 rose 5.54%, and the Nasdaq Composite jumped 7.35%. This market reaction was driven by a lower-than-expected CPI reading, leading traders to anticipate a less aggressive stance from the Federal Reserve regarding interest rate hikes.

title: Bull vs. Bear: Does Meta Stock Have Legs?
summary: This article presents a "Bull vs. Bear" debate on Meta Platforms (META), with Karrie Gordon arguing a bearish stance due to founder Mark Zuckerberg's leadership and the failed metaverse pivot, while Elle Caruso defends a bullish perspective, highlighting Meta's strong user growth, undervalued stock, and strategic AI investments. The discussion covers Meta's financials, controversy surrounding its metaverse investments, and its diverse portfolio of applications beyond Facebook.

title: Meta's rising capex is a response to TikTok and Apple; Cassava Sciences Files Lawsuit Against Perpetrators of 'Short and Distort' Campaign; A pleasant experience flying Spirit Airlines
summary: This article discusses Meta Platforms' increased capital expenditures as a response to competition from TikTok and Apple's privacy changes, arguing these investments are crucial for Meta's adaptation and long-term success despite communication shortcomings. It also covers Cassava Sciences filing a lawsuit against "short and distort" perpetrators, with the author expressing skepticism based on past experiences. Finally, the author shares a surprisingly pleasant experience flying Spirit Airlines, highlighting cost savings despite extra fees.

title: Mutual Funds Have a TikTok Problem
summary: Mutual funds, including those from Fidelity, T. Rowe Price, and BlackRock, hold over $750 million in ByteDance shares, yet their valuations of the private company have either barely budged or increased significantly despite adverse market conditions and regulatory threats facing other social media companies. This valuation disparity raises questions given ByteDance's unprofitability, regulatory risks, and the substantial declines experienced by its public peers like Meta and Snapchat. The article suggests these valuations imply an astronomical market capitalization for ByteDance, far exceeding market realities and the valuations of comparable public companies.

title: Tech investors think they know what will turn around Meta after a 72% implosion this year: Less Mark Zuckerberg
summary: Tech investors believe Meta Platforms Inc. could recover from its 72% stock implosion if CEO Mark Zuckerberg steps back, as his focus on the metaverse is seen as a drain on earnings. Despite his strong control due to the company's capital structure, some investors view the stock as "dirt cheap" and believe it could significantly rise with better management focus on shareholders. Others defend Zuckerberg's long-term vision, citing his past successes and patience.

title: 4 META ETFs With Buy the Dip Opportunity
summary: Following a significant drop in Meta Platforms Inc. (META) stock due to decreased quarterly profits and digital advertising numbers, this article identifies four ETFs presenting a "buy the dip" opportunity. Despite investor concerns over Mark Zuckerberg's metaverse investment, these ETFs hold META with a minimum 10% weight and could rebound. The ETFs highlighted are the Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLC), Vanguard Communications Services ETF (VOX), Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF (FCOM), and Global X Social Media ETF (SOCL).

title: Markets - Medicine Hat NewsMedicine Hat News - Meta Stock Plunges Dragging ETFS for Communication Services
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ: META) experienced a significant stock plunge due to a profit shortfall and anticipated sales issues, impacting several communication-focused ETFs. The Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (NYSEARCA: XLC), Vanguard Communication Services ETF (NYSEARCA: VOX), and Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF (NYSEARCA: FCOM), all with substantial META holdings, saw considerable declines. This downturn exacerbates a broader year-to-date pressure on the sector, with META's stock down 58.9% for the year, dragging down associated ETFs.

title: JPMorgan Chase merchants can now receive payments through Meta Pay
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co's merchants can now accept payments via Meta Pay, offering customers a new secure online payment option. This integration allows users to utilize Meta Pay across Meta's platforms, like WhatsApp and Instagram, for online purchases. Meta Pay, formerly Facebook Pay, was launched in 2019 to unify payment services within Meta's ecosystem.

title: Opinion: This one stock stands out when looking at key data from the FAANG+ group
summary: This article discusses the current landscape for tech-oriented stocks, noting that 2022 has been difficult for the sector. It suggests that smart long-term investors should look for bargains among quality merchandise, particularly within the FAANG group. The piece aims to identify one stock from this group that offers a good combination of low valuation and high growth, despite the challenging market conditions.

title: Opinion: This one stock stands out when looking at key data from the FAANG+ group
summary: This article discusses the challenges faced by tech-oriented stocks in 2022 and suggests that smart long-term investors should look for bargains. It highlights a specific stock within the FAANG group that offers a good combination of low valuation and high growth, despite the difficult market landscape. The FAANG group includes Meta Platforms Inc., Apple Inc., Amazon.com Inc., Netflix Inc., and Alphabet Inc.

title: Wix Becomes An Official React Native Partner
summary: Wix.com Ltd. has announced its new status as an official partner of React Native (RN), an open-source UI software framework. This partnership signifies Wix's increased commitment to promoting open-source programming and advancing the RN framework by contributing its expertise and extensive RN codebase. Wix joins other major tech companies like Meta and Microsoft in shaping the future of React Native, which is used to build cross-platform mobile applications.

title: Mastercard Teams up With Marvel Studios’ Black Panther: Wakanda Forever to Spotlight Small Business Superheroes
summary: Mastercard has partnered with Marvel Studios' "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever" to celebrate Black excellence and the strength of Black women, both on and off-screen. This collaboration spotlights Black women small business owners, like Egypt Otis of Comma Bookstore & Social Hub, through a Wakanda-inspired commercial and various initiatives. Mastercard's efforts extend its $500 million commitment to close the racial wealth and economic gap in the U.S. by supporting Black women-owned businesses through the Strivers Initiative, exclusive screenings, and new digital platforms like the Mastercard Small Biz Marketplace on Instagram and a Small Business Metaverse platform.

title: InterDigital and Inria Launch Joint Lab in Metaverse Tech
summary: InterDigital and Inria have established a joint laboratory named NEMO.AI in Brittany to develop cutting-edge technologies for the metaverse era. The collaboration builds on a long-standing relationship and aims to address the need for a common standard in metaverse avatars and objects, with a focus on AI-based solutions and contributions to the MPEG consortium. The initiative is supported by the French government's post-Covid economic recovery plan.

title: News | GE To Vacate Boston Headquarters, Reduce Office Space Ahead of Spinoff
summary: General Electric is vacating its $200 million Boston headquarters just over three years after moving in, ahead of its planned spinoff into three separate businesses. The multinational conglomerate is seeking smaller office space in Boston and plans to sell its 62-acre Crotonville learning campus in New York, reflecting a broader trend of companies reducing their office footprints due to increased remote work. This move follows similar actions by other major corporations like Meta and Caterpillar.

title: CHEETOS® MAKES MISCHIEF IN THE METAVERSE WITH THE LAUNCH OF HALLOWEEN-THEMED CHESTERVILLE
summary: Cheetos is launching Chesterville, a new Halloween-themed virtual reality experience within Meta Horizon Worlds, marking its first venture into the metaverse. In Chesterville, fans can engage in mischievous games and vote to bring back a favorite, discontinued Cheetos flavor for a limited time in the real world. This initiative aims to broaden Cheetos' engagement with consumers by offering an interactive and innovative brand experience.

title: Coinbase shareholders: Who owns the most COIN stock?
summary: This article examines the major shareholders of Coinbase (COIN), detailing the breakdown between institutional, retail, and insider investors. It highlights the top five shareholders, including Marc Andreessen and major investment firms like Vanguard Group and ARK Investment Management, and discusses their reasons for holding COIN stock and its correlation with cryptocurrency market trends.

title: General Electric cuts hundreds of jobs in the U.S.
summary: General Electric is laying off 20% of its onshore wind workforce in the United States, amounting to hundreds of jobs, in anticipation of an economic recession. This move is part of a broader trend among major American companies, including DocuSign, Gap Inc., Meta, Google, Twilio, Patreon, Snap Inc., Apple, Calm.com, Sweetgreen, Groupon, Fender, and Robinhood, which are also reducing their workforces. Companies are citing market realities and the need to streamline operations and improve profitability as reasons for the job cuts.

title: Game company Roblox enabled girl's sexual exploitation, lawsuit claims
summary: A lawsuit filed in San Francisco accuses online gaming firm Roblox Corp of enabling a California girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men. The lawsuit also targets Discord Inc, Snap Inc, and Meta Platforms Inc, claiming these companies failed to keep minors safe and did not require parental consent or verify age. The girl, who started using Roblox at age nine or ten, allegedly suffered severe mental health problems due to exploitation facilitated through these platforms.

title: Meta launches AI software tools to ease switching between Nvidia, AMD chips
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has launched new open-source AI software tools to enable easier switching between different underlying chips from Nvidia and AMD. These tools, based on PyTorch, can significantly speed up code execution on both Nvidia A100 and AMD MI250 chips, offering developers greater flexibility and reducing migration costs between hardware vendors. This initiative aims to address the vendor lock-in common with Nvidia's CUDA platform and improve hardware choice for deep learning developers.

title: BlackRock to Launch ETF Focused on Metaverse-Related Companies
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has filed to launch an exchange-traded fund (ETF) focused on metaverse-related companies, named the iShares Future Metaverse Tech and Communications ETF. This new offering signals BlackRock's continued expansion into digital assets and virtual platforms, following recent launches of a blockchain company ETF and a bitcoin-trust for institutional clients. The move positions BlackRock to compete with other firms already offering similar metaverse ETFs, reflecting a growing interest in the digital economy.

title: Meta class action alleges Facebook intercepts, monitors, records private browsing activity
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Meta Platforms Inc., alleging that its Facebook app intercepts, monitors, and records users' private browsing activity without their consent. Plaintiffs Gabriele Willis and Kerreisha Davis claim Meta tracks text entries, passwords, and other personal information by rerouting users to an in-app browser and injecting JavaScript code. This alleged practice is also accused of circumventing Apple iOS privacy restrictions that require informed user consent for tracking.

title: 14 best shopping apps of 2025
summary: This article lists the 14 best shopping apps for 2025, categorizing them into marketplace, clothing, social media, cashback, grocery, mystery, and car shopping apps. It highlights the growing trend of mobile commerce and provides detailed descriptions of each app's features and benefits. The article also suggests that marketers consider partnering with these apps to gain awareness and loyalty from shoppers.

title: Never Mind Growth vs. Value Stocks, Look to Beta
summary: This article argues that investors should focus on stock volatility, represented by beta, rather than the traditional growth vs. value distinction, especially given the current economic uncertainty. It highlights that high-beta stocks, despite their risk, are currently undervalued, particularly in cyclical sectors, presenting potential opportunities. The author also suggests that low-beta stocks can offer a haven for risk-averse investors in uncertain times.

title: Salesforce unveils Genie, a real-time data platform to power its apps
summary: Salesforce Inc. has unveiled Salesforce Genie, a new real-time data platform designed to power its entire suite of customer relationship management products. Genie aims to unify and personalize customer data in real-time, enabling highly personalized experiences across marketing, sales, and commerce, and addressing data fragmentation issues caused by numerous separate applications.

title: Expert: Zillow Privacy Lawsuit Has Wider Implications
summary: A civil lawsuit filed against Zillow Group Inc. and Microsoft Corp. alleges privacy violations through the collection of user interaction data on Zillow's website, including mouse movements and keystrokes. An expert in internet privacy law suggests this case, and similar ones, could force significant changes in how companies draft their privacy policies and collect user data. The core issue revolves around the vagueness of Zillow's privacy policy and whether it adequately discloses the extent of data collection to consumers.

title: Nikko unveils metaverse ETF in Hong Kong
summary: Nikko Asset Management has launched a new actively managed metaverse thematic equity ETF in Hong Kong, the NikkoAM Metaverse Theme Active ETF, listed in HKD (3091 HK) and USD (9091 HK). The ETF offers exposure to companies globally involved in developing and enabling the metaverse, with estimated ongoing charges of 1.25%. This new offering joins the CSOP Metaverse Concept ETF (3034 HK) and the Samsung Asia Pacific ex NZ Metaverse Theme ETF (3172 HK) in the Hong Kong market.

title: Tesla struggles with Elon Musk’s strict return-to-office policy
summary: Three months after Elon Musk's strict return-to-office mandate, Tesla faces challenges with insufficient office space and resources to accommodate all employees. The policy has led to a decline in morale, increased absenteeism tracking, and the dismissal of some remote workers who could not relocate, impacting the company's ability to retain talent.

title: Meta, Qualcomm sign pact on custom virtual reality chips | Hindustan Times
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. and Qualcomm Inc. have signed an agreement for Qualcomm to produce custom chipsets for Meta's Quest virtual reality (VR) devices. This collaboration highlights Meta's reliance on Qualcomm's technology while it also develops its own custom silicon for its VR, augmented, and mixed reality devices. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed, and the custom chipsets will be optimized for Quest's system specifications, though not exclusive to Meta.

title: Snap CEO to restructure company, cut 20% of workforce
summary: Snap Inc. is restructuring its operations and laying off 20% of its workforce after experiencing its slowest-ever revenue growth in Q2 and a significant net loss. CEO Evan Spiegel stated the company will refocus on revenue and user growth, and augmented reality (AR) to ensure long-term success. This strategic shift includes discontinuing non-core projects like Snap Originals, Minis, Games, Pixy, Zenly, and Voisey, while also authorizing a $500 million stock buyback program.

title: Gaming industry advancing development of virtual ecosystem: Co-Founder of Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF
summary: Matthew Ball, CEO and Co-Founder of the Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF, discusses the progress of the gaming industry in developing a virtual ecosystem. The discussion covers the future of virtual real estate companies, the capabilities of 3D rendering, and the practical aspects of building a virtual world.

title: $37.5M Meta settlement resolves data privacy claims over tracking technology
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. has agreed to pay $37.5 million to settle a class-action lawsuit alleging it violated user privacy by tracking location data even when location services were turned off.
